intro: Ceropegia racemosa subsp. secamonoides, commonly known as the Madagascar star vine, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and fleshy, often hairy stems. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink, which bloom in clusters. It thrives in warm, humid environments and is often found in forest understories or rocky areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated as a houseplant or in tropical gardens.
